_comments: In the editor value change 'default' to 'nano', 'vi', or another terminal based editor.
Hosts will also be read from your ~/.ssh/config or /etc/ssh_config file, if available
For more information on how to configure, please see http://fitztrev.github.io/shuttle/

Jupyer Lab üöÄ.name: ‚ùåTurn off Jupyter Lab üöÄ
Jupyer Lab üöÄ.cmd: kill -9 $(ps -ef | grep 'jupyter-lab' | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}') ; exit

Jupyer Lab üöÄ.name: üîçQuery Jupyter Lab Port
Jupyer Lab üöÄ.cmd: ps -ef | grep 'jupyter-lab' | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I{} lsof -aPi -p {}

HTTP(S) Proxy 8080.name: ‚úÖTurn on HTTP(S) Proxy
HTTP(S) Proxy 8080.cmd: echo COMPUTER_PASSWD | sudo -S networksetup -setwebproxy 'Wi-Fi' 127.0.0.1 8080 && sudo networksetup -setsecurewebproxy 'Wi-Fi' 127.0.0.1 8080; exit

HTTP(S) Proxy 8080.name: ‚ùåTurn off HTTP(S) Proxy
HTTP(S) Proxy 8080.cmd: echo COMPUTER_PASSWD | sudo -S networksetup -setwebproxystate 'Wi-Fi' off && sudo networksetup -setsecurewebproxystate 'Wi-Fi' off; exit

HTTP(S) Proxy 8889.name: ‚úÖTurn on HTTP(S) Proxy
HTTP(S) Proxy 8889.cmd: echo COMPUTER_PASSWD | sudo -S networksetup -setwebproxy 'Wi-Fi' 127.0.0.1 8889 && sudo networksetup -setsecurewebproxy 'Wi-Fi' 127.0.0.1 8889; exit

HTTP(S) Proxy 8889.name: ‚ùåTurn off HTTP(S) Proxy
HTTP(S) Proxy 8889.cmd: echo COMPUTER_PASSWD | sudo -S networksetup -setwebproxystate 'Wi-Fi' off && sudo networksetup -setsecurewebproxystate 'Wi-Fi' off; exit
